string.text: Thank you... err... Marked One, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that... Could I be of additional help to you?
I'm looking for Lab X-16. The Barkeep told me you might have info about its location.

We've long had an interest in Lab X-16...or, rather, in the mechanism inside it that generates emissions which directly affects people's consciousness. I'm afraid I have to disappoint you: the place is impossible to penetrate without special psi-armor. The outcome is known in advance - even if you could evade the swarms of zombies that infest the laboratory entrance, you run the risk of becoming one of them. This is all very serious. However, we've designed a screening device to help shield the emission, but to fine-tune it we have to obtain additional measurements. If you help us with this task, we could probably provide you with a fully calibrated prototype for field testing.
Measurements?

If you, together with our associate, take all the necessary measurements, I will prepare a fully workable prototype of the armor and will give it to you. It will most likely let you get inside the laboratory.
Okay, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Kruglov and get going. He is already equipped with the necessary gear.
Okay
Okay, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Semenov and get going. He's got everything you will need.
Okay
No... right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.
Yes, Sir? What might you be looking for?
I'm looking for Lab X-16. The Barkeep told me you might have info about its location.
Thank you, Marked One, for rescuing Kruglov. Take this pressurized suit as a reward for your troubles. Also, I suspect you didn't come here for a simple reward, am I right?
I'm looking for Lab X-16. The Barkeep told me that you might have info about its location.

We have been studying the emission in Lab X-16 for a long time, but you won't get in there without special equipment. We've developed a psi-protection device that can help shield you from the emission, but needs some fine-tuning. If you could help us with that, I could give you a working prototype that you can use to get inside the laboratory.
Okay
Excellent, talk to Kruglov and get going. He's got everything you'll need.
No, I'm not up for this yet.
That's a real pity. So far we've been unable to send a measurement expedition of our own.
Yes, Sir? What might you be looking for?

We've long had an interest in Lab X-16...or, rather, in the mechanism inside it that generates emissions which directly affects people's consciousness. I'm afraid I have to disappoint you: the place is impossible to penetrate without special psi-armor. The outcome is known in advance - even if you could evade the swarms of zombies that infest the laboratory entrance, you run the risk of becoming one of them. This is all very serious. However, we've designed a screening device to help shield the emission, but to fine-tune it we have to obtain additional measurements. If you help us with this task, we could probably provide you with a fully calibrated prototype for field testing.
Go on.

We have been studying the emission in Lab X-16 for a long time, but you won't get in there without special equipment. We've developed a psi-protection device that can help shield you from the emission, but needs some fine-tuning. If you could help us with that, I could give you a working prototype that you can use to get inside the laboratory.
Okay, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Kruglov and get going. He is already equipped with the necessary gear.
Okay
Okay, I agree.
Excellent! Talk to Semenov and get going. He's got everything you will need.
Okay
You don't understand, there's an emitter. No one has been able to come closer than half a kilometre - it makes a zombie out of anyone. Going there without a suit is just like suicide, get it?
Hmm. That changes things.
To hell with it, just tell me all you know.

Okay, but don't say I didn't warn you. Vasiliev worked on the laboratory problem. About a week ago, he and stalker by the name of Ghost attempted to get inside the laboratory. After several hours we felt a shake and emissions stopped; after another hour, we got a signal from Vasiliev, it was coming from the swamp but then vanished. By the looks of things, Vasiliev is gone. Try to find his body: he had accurate information about the laboratory - where it is and how to get in. He might have also known how to turn off the emissions. The laboratory entrance is most likely hidden in the basement of one of the buildings in the power plant area.
There we go, great.
No... right now I don't want to sign up for this.
That's too bad, a real pity... I don't know how or when we could carry out this measurement expedition on our own.

Thank you... mmm... Marked One, right? You helped save our associate Kruglov and in order to show my sincere appreciation I would like to present you with one of our working suits. It comes in very handy, you should know that...

You did a splendid job, Marked One! Now that the emissions are turned off, we will be able to order new expeditions and explore previously inaccessible territories. And also... from now on we will conduct a most favorable pricing policy toward you. Oh, I almost forgot... check your PDA, I've uploaded some info about so-called 'artefact modificates'. Hope, you'll find it useful.
Thank you.
Yes, Marked One? What are you looking for?
You did an excellent job. If the measurements are correct, the prototype should provide you with maximum protection from emission.
Glad to hear that.

Now your path to the laboratory is clear... except that if the source of the emission isn't destroyed and doesn't lose its power, you may not have enough time to get back. So, my dear Sir, here is the deal. Our calculations have produced an estimated location of the source as well as the fact that it is under ground. With your permission, I have already marked the spot on your map.
How exactly does one get inside Lab X-16? Where is the entrance?

Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X-16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
Okay, I'll try.
Why did he die? You were supposed to protect him!
Kruglov got killed by the zombies... I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
Oh, man...how could this happen? How could this happen??! Damn it, everything is going wrong again. Now we'll have to call for more people... We've got enough problems as it is... Damn...
Listen... Kruglov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X-16.

Here is a prototype, be careful with it. It's not calibrated properly, but that's your fault - you failed to save our colleague. The device won't provide maximum protection, but at least it will lower the emission's intensity. So, stalker, you'll have to move fast on your way to the source.
How does one get inside Lab X-16? Where exactly is the entrance?

Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Anything else?

You must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X-16 than he admitted to us. If he has survived somehow... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
Okay, I'll try.
Why did he die? Weren't you supposed to protect him?!
Semenov got shot by the zombies... I couldn't help it, there were too many of them.
Oh, man...how could this happen? How could this happen??! Damn it, everything is going wrong again. Now we'll have to call for more people... We've got enough problems as it is... Damn...
Listen... Semenov is gone, but I'm alive. Give me the prototype. I will fight my way inside X-16.

Here is a prototype, be careful with it. It's not calibrated properly, but that's your fault - you failed to save our colleague. The device won't provide maximum protection, but at least it will lower the emission's intensity. So, stalker, you'll have to move fast on your way to the source.
How does one get inside Lab X-16? Where exactly is the entrance?

Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X-16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
Okay, I'll try.
Yes, Marked One?
Yes, Marked One?
It's too bad that Kruglov died... Alas, nothing can bring him back. It's most important that you bring us the measurement data. Did you?
Yeah. Here.
Ok, let me adjust the prototype. Wait for me here.
Gotcha.
No.
Then get them, and quick! I cannot calibrate the prototype properly without them.
You did an excellent job. If the measurements are correct, the prototype should provide you with maximum protection from emission.
Can you be a little more clear?

Stalker, now you will be able to break through to the laboratory, but unless you turn off the emitter, you won't last long even with the psi-protection on. We've estimated an approximate location of the emitter; it is located in an underground facility. I have marked the spot on your map.
How do I get inside X-16? Where exactly is the entrance?

Vasiliev was working on the lab issue. About a week ago he and a stalker called Ghost tried to get inside. A couple of hours later we felt a major tremor, and after another hour we picked up a signal from Vasiliev coming from the swamp, but it died away. And Vasiliev died away with it, it would seem. Try to find his corpse. He had the exact information on the lab and the way to get into it. There may even be info on deactivating that source of the emission. I've uploaded you all the data we have.
Ahem...It would be very interesting to take a look at these documents. So, you think Vasiliev has them?

Perhaps. At any rate, you must start by finding Vasiliev's body - that is the only chance of obtaining accurate information about the lab's location. The body of your colleague, Ghost, must be somewhere there as well. You know, it seemed to me like he knew a lot more about X-16 than he admitted to us. Had he somehow survived... Well, it's no use holding on to that hope, of course.
Okay, I'll try.
There's no time...
Yes, Marked One?
The professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.

Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly - just make sure not to let those cadavers get too close. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again...
Okay

Wow! Marked One here on a personal visit! Finally you've made it to our parts. Talk to the Professor - he wants to thank you for rescuing me. And, also, check your PDA. I've uploaded some useful info for you.
Later, later!
Hey, Marked One! How are things going?
Yes, Marked One?
Professor asked me to take a trip to the measurement site.

Now you're talking business! Let's move out immediately. It was no use getting there alone, but with you it's different... I think we'll manage quickly - just make sure not to let those cadavers too close to you. So, you ready?
Yeah.
You know what... Why don't you go first. You've got a whole lot of experience, unlike me. And those cadavers are starting to move again...
Okay.
I'm sorry, I have no time for this right now.
Hey, Marked One! How's life?
Wait a little bit... We need to finish talking.
Wait! I'm not done taking measurements!
Yipe!. Ouch... Argh...
You alive? C'mon, get up... Get up slowly. It's all over. It's behind us now.
Hey, Marked One. How are you?
Done! Pack the camera, time to get going!
Hey, Marked One! How's life?
About it, smart guy, already have heard. And Sidorovich told you?
Yes.
So you want to learn?
You participated in this expedition?

It was supposed to, but did not participate... I can hardly talk about this terrible tragedy. Then pogiblo lot of my friends and colleagues... On the other hand, since two years have passed... But since you are so interested, then I guess I'll start my story. As I said, this happened two years ago. It all began with a scientific congress in Berlin, the main theme of which was the area and its impact on the environment. As a result, it was decided to equip a scientific expedition to the Zone, led by leading scientific experts, to gather information and study the nature of the Zone. Shortly found sponsors who have agreed everything with the Government of Ukraine and three months later began preparations for the expedition at a military base on the edge of Chernobyl. Ah, then here came all the light of the scientific world, known foreign and domestic scientists: physicists, chemists, biologists, ecologists.
In general I know it. Further.

Was zakuplena Curb weight: different devices, spetsoborudovanie, mobile laboratories, protective clothing, etc. As of Government has allocated us two special police troops and even special BTR'y. Also in the expedition were to participate Stalker guides, translators and even journalists. In general, after a two-week training and mentoring expedition to the Zone in the City-32. That it should have this happen! The day before the shipment I got sick and had to lie down for four days in the hospital that, in theory, and saved my life. A as I was sorry about that I can not yet go to the expedition, as envious colleagues... I then promised that after his recovery will be me by helicopter to the scientific camp. Meanwhile, the expedition reached the town of-32. Helicopter thrown back cell research camp, like the one in which you are now, have established a relationship with the base and took up the study. At first, everything went perfectly. We started to measure the radiation level, to study various features of the anomalies, the chemical composition of artefacts. Every day we receive regular reports from the camp of the new discoveries and otkrytiyax - in the success of the expedition no doubt. Meanwhile, I lay on a cot in the infirmary, and kicking themselves...
Further.

But soon the camp began to take place weird things. Cnachala we noticed excessive aggressiveness and irritability in the voices on the radio, but did not attach much importance to the nerves, then not all the iron. 3atem somewhere lost two special. Three days after the beginning of the expedition, we received a message stating that one of the scientists, Professor Rosenberg is overly agitated state, committed suicide by shooting himself. This news shocked us! And two days later sank a radio message from the camp. We stayed in complete bewilderment, it was decided to send a helicopter to the camp, but because of the strong storm that was not possible. We could do was wait. A day later we received a message from the two stalkers who have seen the night a group of people on BTR'e at Rotten Woods, in an ambush the bandits. The military sent there immediately written special ops. What happened there, you have already told all stages, I can only add that survived the ambush, three members of the expedition, hidden in the woods. When we found them, they were more like animals than people - the wild, frightened, bedraggled. They initially looked like a patient in a psychiatric hospital, not even hard to believe that a week ago they were still normal. It took about a month intensive treatment to at least partially restore their psyche.
Also that as a result?

After analyzing the incident and the stories of survivors, the commission concluded that the cause of death of the expedition was the psychotropic radiation of unprecedented power, which in the zone called 'vyzhigatelem brain. " As a result of a long stay under this radiation in humans began to break down psyche: appeared unprecedented aggression, rage and savagery. Some could not cope with the psychological stress and kill themselves as poor Professor Rosenberg. Some poured out aggression on others, attacked them and killed like mad animals. The camp started in shambles. A still here and mutants arrived, using the lack of protection. Those who have not yet completely mad, trying to return to BTR'e, but halfway was ambushed by bandits and killed in a shootout. So it died expedition to City-32... Since then, I vowed not to leave the zone until you have learned it damn radiation and can not find protection from him... Hy, Spot, I spoke here with you, it's time for work.
Yes-yes, you I will not detain, professor...
No.
Well then ask better it, I now do not have time for stories.
Professor, you have any useful info about mutants?
Yes, certainly - here Kruglov's last report on poltergeists.
Very much even it is interesting to listen, I about them heard a miscellaneous earlier.

So. What we know about the poltergeist:
1. This is (presumably) the people that are in force ogromnoy ejection. They are higher telepaths can subdue the people, animals, mutants, partially - controllers.
2. Do not be visible in the physical appearance. According to the stalkers out of their heads - leaky storm or fire education. Nobody knows what happens after death the soul is also not known whether they all kill.
3. Telekinetic abilities vary. They can throw objects, from small to as much iron doors.
4. Establish a link between reproductive telepathy. Initially slated to appear Poltergeist. From him is the controller, it is unknown how, presumably - the controller is a person for a long time been under the influence of the poltergeist, poltergeist where reason and man weave, and at some point, the controller aborts poltergeist out of his mind. Controller then regresses in byurera. Information Concerning received from scientists in the center of the zone, the link that was lost 2 years ago.
5. Supposed to live in caves, although the effect was found throughout the zone.
6. Energy analysis of the controller found Energosvyaz with higher intelligence. Presumably, poltergeist. So, poltergeist can kill violating energy balance its essence...
As good as possible?
Shoot them nuzhno, Marked One, and more.
Yasnenko, many thanks for the info!
Yes Professor, you have something want to ask?

Marked One you see I need Ghost's PDA, please find and bring it to me. It has valuable information on it of not yet completely studied artefacts, which can be found only near the center of the zone. Of course I will repay you.
If I find it, I will bring it to you.
I hope you Marked One. For me and for the whole scientific world, this information is of great value.
Hello Doctor, I have brought what you asked for.
Oh, you found ego. Kakaya luck. I am very grateful to you Marked One. Here, take it to you for the trouble.
The doctor wanted to ask. In the PDA was writing about Fang from the group of Strelok. Maybe you know anything about his death?
To be honest, I do not know much. Ask Voronin. Not long before the ghost with Vasilyev went to the underground lab, he told me that they had some things in common. Perhaps Voronin will tell you more.
